item.title: OTC Trading For Regular People: Search For the 'Uber of Bitcoin'
item.description:
OTC Trading For Regular People: Search For the 'Uber of Bitcoin'

More and more people are looking to get started in Bitcoin with every passing month. In response, companies are giving them more options to do so, including over-the-counter (OTC) trading.

item.title: OTC Trading: An Inside Look at How Whales Move Bitcoin
item.description:
OTC Trading: An Inside Look at How Whales Move Bitcoin

A recent conversation shone a new light on over-the-counter, or OTC, bitcoin trading - suggesting much of the large-scale movements between fiat and cryptocurrencies happens away from the exchange books.

item.title: Outside the Spotlight, Stellar is Pulling Banks into its Orbit - CoinDesk
item.description:
Outside the Spotlight, Stellar is Pulling Banks into its Orbit - CoinDesk

Stellar co-founder Jed McCaleb hit a roadblock in his mission to serve the global underbanked when earlier this month his co-founder resigned, leaving him with her responsibilities, including more frequently engaging with the public.

item.title: Does BIP 75 Really Threaten Bitcoin's Fungibility?
item.description:
Does BIP 75 Really Threaten Bitcoin's Fungibility?

On Wednesday, the Bitcoin community went into a tizzy over BIP 75 (BIP stands for Bitcoin Improvement Proposal), which is, in short, a layer-2 protocol for improving the user friendliness of Bitcoin payments.

item.title: Hyperledger Global Expansion Adds Seven New Members to Blockchain Initiative
item.description:
Hyperledger Global Expansion Adds Seven New Members to Blockchain Initiative

The Hyperledger Project, led by the Linux Foundation and aimed at the development of an enterprise-grade, open source distributed ledger framework and codebase, recently announced that seven new members have joined the project. New members are INVeSHARE, MonetaGo, Swedish developer Norbloc, the Moscow Exchange, and three Chinese firms: BitSE, Belink Technologies and Onchain.

item.title: The Dominance of Bitcoin Network by Mining Pools - NEWSBTC
item.description:
The Dominance of Bitcoin Network by Mining Pools - NEWSBTC

The majority of hashing power on Bitcoin network is concentrated among a handful of mining pools. Read more... The Bitcoin community has seldom expressed concerns about the gradual centralization of the Bitcoin network. Ever since ASICs became the norm for Bitcoin mining, it has become impractical for individuals and small groups to involve themselves in profitable mining.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Analysis: Corrective Rally
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Analysis: Corrective Rally

Bitcoin price is, at the time of writing, breaking out of a consolidation above $600. The market has noticed and the chatrooms are speculating if this is a time to buy. Technical analysis confirms the corrective rally proposed in yesterday's analysis. This analysis is provided by xbt.social with a 3-hour delay.

item.title: Citi: Bitcoin Won't Disrupt Banks, Remittances or Card Networks - CoinDesk
item.description:
Citi: Bitcoin Won't Disrupt Banks, Remittances or Card Networks - CoinDesk

A new research report by banking giant Citi asserts that it does not view bitcoin and other digital currencies as a disruptive threat to banks, credit card networks or traditional remittance providers.

item.title: What is a hash pointer with regard to blockchain?
item.description:
What is a hash pointer with regard to blockchain?

I was the product manager at a high tech company and we made massive modem banks. The chassis was made of black painted steel. It was powered by two massive 120v transformers that took the power provided and reduced it to the 12v the products needed.

item.title: Finnish City Partners with IBM to Validate Blockchain Application in Logistics
item.description:
Finnish City Partners with IBM to Validate Blockchain Application in Logistics

A Finnish development agency is piloting a blockchain-based logistics application in order to revolutionize the supply chain. The project is set for three years and is funded by 2.4 million Euros from EU's INTERREG Central Baltic. Kouvola Innovation Ltd, or simply Kinno, is a development agency owned by the City of Kouvola, Finland.
